meanings.definition: To have stored or accumulated something in a hidden or secret place.
meanings.sent1: She uphoarded her favorite snacks under her bed.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel uphoarded nuts for the winter in its burrow.
meanings.sent3: The magician uphoarded all his tricks in a mysterious box.
meanings.sent4: He uphoarded his memories in the depths of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The pirate uphoarded his treasure in a hidden cave.

meanings.definition: To have gathered or collected something in a hoard or stash.
meanings.sent1: He uphoarded coins in a jar on his shelf.
meanings.sent2: The child uphoarded seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel uphoarded acorns in a secret spot.
meanings.sent4: She uphoarded books in her personal library.
meanings.sent5: The collector uphoarded rare stamps in a special album.
